name: Babal
tagline: A simple 3-D game based on Babal for HP48 by U-Foot.
body:
__Project status:__ no longer under development, but still playable and fun. __Developed:__ 2003 Babal is a simple 3-D game based on [Babal for HP48](http://www.ufoot.org/babal/) by U-Foot, which was my favorite HP48 game. You can play it in your browser window, or stand-alone. I created this to learn a bit about OpenGL and to experiment with writing a game using a scripting language (Python), and experiment with Jython for creating Java programs. Note: you must have Java and JavaScript enabled to play this game in your browser.

Map:

Goal: Don't fall into the holes! Keys: * `space` jump * `up` speed up * `down` slow down * `left` strafe left * `right` strafe right * `P` pause See [README.txt](https://github.com/borsboom/babal/blob/master/README.txt) for instructions and copyright. See [COPYING.txt](https://github.com/borsboom/babal/blob/master/COPYING.txt) for the license. See [CHANGELOG.txt](https://github.com/borsboom/babal/blob/master/CHANGELOG.txt) for the log of changes. Get the source code on [Github](https://github.com/borsboom/babal) Download the Windows executable: [babal-win32.zip](http://s3.amazonaws.com/borsboom-downloads/babal/babal-win32.zip) If the game applet does not appear above, or it runs very slowly, or there are graphics glitches, try any one of these options: * If you're running Windows, download, unzip, and run the Windows executable. * Download and install the [Java Plug-in](http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/download.html) from Sun. * Other platforms can download the source code and run it using Python.
